properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 4:41AM PST until March 2 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Hanford CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Snow levels will begin around 4500 feet,
lowering to 3000 feet by this evening. Total snow accumulations
of a dusting to one inch at 3000 feet, with two to four inches
above 4000 feet. Black ice is also possible along Interstate 5
above 3000 feet tonight through Monday morning.

* WHERE...Interstate 5 though the Grapevine, including the cities
of Frazier Park and Lebec.

* WHEN...From noon today to 7 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Motorists should anticipate travel delays and slick,
hazardous road conditions, as well as the potential for road
closures above 4000 feet.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET
